title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was about an hour. There were 4 people in the interview panel and they all asked both technical and behavioral questions. And there were multiple rounds of questions in that one hour.
Interview Questions: Where will you see yourself in the next 5 years?

title: Teaching Assistants Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: With instructor, face to face interview, discuss the previous working experience, the availability for marking cases, teaching lecture, answering students question. I know the instructor personally, therefore, it’s an informal interview.
Interview Questions: Courses have been taken, grade, availability.

title: Community Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: in person charrette of questions - you need to be honest and personable during this process. Dont be nervous or too stiff. It is best to relax and just be yourself, thinking about how you can best show how you care for your community
Interview Questions: to teach a certain skill

title: Sr Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Overall the process was straight forward, focus was on behavioural questions and knowledge of institutional investing (including knowledge of various asset classes, strategies and how they differ from each other, etc.)
Interview Questions: Can you tell us a little bit about yourself

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview by three people from the Department. Initially it was resume shortlisting followed by Panel interview. It was an hour long interview with moderate to high difficulty level.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself in detail and how your profile will be a good fit for us

title: Research Assiant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Over zoom, it was fairly standard with other research position team members. I learned more about the company and values and also they gave me opportunity to discuss about myself.
Interview Questions: How do you manage different different task

title: Senior Motion Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Even if I was not chosen, they gave me good feedback about why they didn't move forward with me. It helps me learn about the hiring process in Canada and recalibrate my future applications.
Interview Questions: What are your salary expectations?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Talk with a Professor and tour of the labs. Afterwards talked about potential skills I could offer to the lab, and hours as I was still attending classes which was kind of nice
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. There was a clear set of instructions provided to me regarding the hiring process. There are certain quizzes and learning materials to go through before you get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work as a teaching assistant?

title: Program Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed only once by two people. It was smooth, conversational and sraight to the point. I was made to feel very comfortable and less tensed. After a week of interview, I was made a verbal offer
Interview Questions: What is your experience using Microsoft excel and how advanced are you with it?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Quick phone interview then Interview over Zoom. It can be a bit distracting as the interviewers seems to be looking all over the place when they're looking at multiple screens.
Interview Questions: Structured vs Unstructured work What kind of spreadsheets did you build How do you ensure you don't get bored of doing the repeated tasks

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: It was a zoom interview, that was conducted for about 30 minutes. Straight forward questions, related previous teaching experience. Not too difficult, felt rather like a discussions, with details about the position/role. The asked about the previous courses that I taught and feedback that I received from my previous students.
Interview Questions: Details about previous teaching experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Emailed to set up an interview, held with the project PI, Project Manager, and the Unit Manager. They were flexible and offered both in person and zoom options, willing to accommodate my schedule.
Interview Questions: How do you manage tasks that have different priorities.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got interview invitation through email one month later, just one round interview with finance managers, about 1 hour, and offers provided immediately after the interview. simple and direct, good experience.
Interview Questions: what is your 5 year career plan?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 virtual interviews with different individuals.  Overall, they were friendly and asked the usual interview questions including some behavioral and technical questions. The interviews lasted 30 to 45 mins each.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you disagreed with your supervisor.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Met over Zoom for a scheduled 30 min interview but lasted closer to 45 min due to very interesting conversations being held. Great experience. The recruiter was very welcoming and made it a low stress environment.
Interview Questions: Tell me a more about your research experiences

title: Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Was asked basic HR questions. Send over resume and cover letter over email as it was through a recommendation. It was pretty simple overall. Interview was completed in person. Some personality questions and some technical work experience questions. Pretty simple overall.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and what do you do?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions, more of testing to see if you fit with your PI. Was asked to demonstrate a research method I would use. Know your topic well and be prepared.
Interview Questions: What research methodologies have you used?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Easy going and very clear. I was excited to have been selected out of many. In the end, I got some great publication and collaborative work done. Easy going and very clear. I was excited to have been selected out of many. In the end, I got some great publication and collaborative work done.
Interview Questions: Related to the project of.interest.

title: Student Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a traditional interview setup where the employers interviewed the candidate in person. There were two people interviewing me for this position. They encouraged me to speak and present my viewpoint.
Interview Questions: Tell us about where you had to make a decision quickly.

title: Senior Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: It was a Zoom interview with three people. The interviewer asked me to write a communications strategy with social media posts and create a presentation for the interview. I find it extremely inappropriate for an organization of this size to ask job candidates to do real work for free. Communications strategies are the most important part of a company's marketing, not something that should be farmed out to job seekers.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this role?

title: Learning Commons Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions:
The planning was excellent, and virtual options given. The interviewers included the manager, the manager's manager, and a coworker. Made me feel very comfortable.

We started with some basic service scenarios, moved into reference questions, technology experience, conflict and communication scenarios, and the reasons why I was interested in working here.

Honestly, I did prepare quite well for the interview, so I expected the questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were helping one patron and another patron arrived to interrupt you to ask another question?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Got an invitation to interview the day after posting closed. Interviewers were extremely kind. Relaxed setting during interview. There were lots of behavioural questions. The interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict you have encountered and how you dealt with it.

title: Human Resources Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: The interview is a typical behaviour interview. The behaviour interview was roughly thirty minutes long. There were at least two interviewers, hiring manager and the director of the department. They take turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your work?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: First stage was a Screening interview via ZOOM that was 15 minutes in length. General questions about experience and interest. Provided description of position, salary and expectations. Next step was a teaching demo and panel interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Specialist, Identity and Messaging Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The first call was a very informal discussion with the team lead to verify the details of the resume submitted were legitimate and that they didn't "waste their resources" on a formal interview.

The second call was a panel interview with the team lead and two technical peers. A lot of the questions asked were standard HR questions. Some of the technical questions were very vague and incomplete. When asked for clarification, nobody could expand on the questions asked. 

The team lead ended the call stating they would be making a decision with the hiring manager on which candidate to hire and would call all interviewees the following week regardless of their success. No call was ever made by the team lead.
Interview Questions: How would you verify a compromised Exchange server is safe again?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screen, Panel Interview with three leaders and then a coffee "fit" interview.  Overall the process took about 1 month although I got just 24 hours notice for the panel interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral type - tell me about a time/ How would you handle ....

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: It was done over MS Teams with the manager and director.  Very comfortable and nice people to talk to.  I felt they asked relevant questions and listened intently to my questions as well.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with large amounts of data processing.

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, they had me do a copyedit for a small paragraph that was from an email going out to students. Interview was with director, office manager, HR, and supervisor. Each person asked a few questions.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me a time when you did not get alone with someone you worked with, what did you do to handle the conflict?

title: Finance AR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was challenging . There are several categories. It helps if you have lots of experience.
Long and detailed questions.  They take it very seriously and have people who are well prepared.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self and career?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard interview and they asked several of the common interview questions. Application was online. Interview process was around a month. There was just one set of interviews.
Interview Questions: What are your some of your strengths?

title: Publishing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very speedy process Technical questions were asked and they got back to me with a decision very quickly. I also discussed my schedule and availability because it was a part time position. It was also a hybrid working model
Interview Questions: How are index created in a book

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Process took a week. Applied through student portal and got an interview right away. Interview was pretty standard with some basic questions about getting to know you and your experience.
Interview Questions: Some basic STAR technique questions

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: The interview for a coop student internship position was quite fair. It consisted mostly of behavioural questions. This was done in person and was interviewed by two people (manager and colleague).
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Online interview with the manager to get a rundown of the job as well as the commitment necessary, how to deal with both having a job at uni while attending and what not
Interview Questions:
How can you manage school and work
how many hours a week
Why are you passionate about helping prospective students

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication happened via email. The interview was about 30 min long with the PI, it was a little casual, he gave an overview of the position, then asked about me, and why i was interested in that position. Over all a good experience.
Interview Questions: tell me of a time when you had to troubleshoot something

title: Communications and Engagement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: very nice and friendly interviewers, asked a few questions about myself and some behavioural questions. they also asked me about what I would do in certain situations if I were hired for the position
Interview Questions: How would you promote a Career centre event around campus

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Casual interview process, had to draw out my process on the board. Interviewer gave me information and asked how I would record and organize the information and I demonstrated live how I would document notes and information.
Interview Questions: What is your experience researching? How have you done analysis?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with my Supervisor. The process was smooth and very respectful. There were a couple interviews with the supervisor and an informal meeting with the lab, to talk about the projects, extracurriculars, etc.
Interview Questions:
What are your current qualifications and list of publications?
How can you contribute to the current lab environment?
What skills do you wish to learn and your next steps.

title: Seasonal Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and straightforward . Interviewed by direct supervisor. Asked reasonable questions and answered my queries well. Good on boarding program and introduction to desire to learn. Well supported by administration team and IT. Course grading was easy to understand.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching style

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, great, they were kind and clear about their expectations. Showed me around the lab. Went through the parts of the job that are often the most enjoyable. After being hired they were again kind and clear about their expectations.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest thing you've done?

title: Co-Op Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Contact by email from HR for a time to call. Phone interview with basic HR questions, availability to work. Remote interview set up with manager shortly after the phone interview. Very easy interview. Just be yourself.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: IT Customer Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions:
After submitting my application, I got a response for a Phone interview after that I got scheduled for the main interview.
The main interview was okay, the manager was friendly and everything went well.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to an angry customer?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial first interview was via Microsoft Teams, with Supervisor, one on one. Questions were basic on why I wanted the position, what my salary expectations were and understanding the union.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Community Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed virtually at the Hunter Hub for Entrepreneurial Thinking with the Director and her EA. The Director had a list of 14 questions and, after a brief introduction, she started asking questions from the list. They were standard interview questions and not particularly difficult.  

Pros: 
- Welcoming and friendly 

Cons: 
- Impersonal/ dry interview. There was little room for casual conversation between questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your favourite University of Calgary startup?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: there was only one interview. Skype call since I wasn't in the city. The interview was panel (3 people), informal. very nice people. Then I got offer two weeks late. It's a research position
Interview Questions: Mostly about previous experience and some common questions

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had to provide a lecture to faculty members. I had to provide a classroom lecture to advance students. The interview was a couple of hours with a panel of faculty members. There was a second  interview with administration.  this was a very high stress situation wherein division politics were obvious.
Interview Questions: Why was I leaving my present position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Inter personal and project based questions. They had done their research and have a lot of cool projects to relate on.  Many topics to talk about with them at the end because they are open people.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose your degree?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: They ask about your GPA generally, as well as your interests to the PI's specific research topic. Make sure to read one or two of the most recent publications to understand their current direction.
Interview Questions: What sort of class have you taken. What sort of lab experience do you have.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews. Two with the team and one with senior leadership. Straight forward questions mostly behavioural. No curveballs were asked during interview and the interviewers were quite candid in answering questions.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for the UofC?

title: IT Customer Service Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Well structured and easy. The interview was very casual and contained questions describing my skills and weaknesses and how I would manage customers. 
Well structured and easy. The interview was very casual and contained questions describing my skills and weaknesses and how I would manage customers.
Interview Questions: Questions describing my skills and weaknesses and how I would manage customers

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Search firm engaged me to interview for a senior position. Met hiring VP for a brief meet and greet and was then introduced to her boss for another 30 minute interview.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this position?
Describe a situation where you failed in a past role?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied via the U of C careers page. I was then contacted for a phone screen followed by two in person interviews. The second in person interview was a meet and greet with my team.
Interview Questions: Name 3 strengths and 3 weaknesses

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: I approached one of the current student working in the library. He connected me to the manager. The manager set up a coffee meet and chatted about my interest in joining the library. He then told me that he will get back to me
Interview Questions: Do you like to around books

title: IT Customer Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Typically interviewed by a panel of two people. Standard behavioural questions, situational questions, basic technical questions. Some questions to see if you will be a good fit on the team.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced conflict at the workplace

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: It a co-op position through UBC co-op. Interview was over Skype and around 30 min. Whole process probably a few weeks. The interviewer (PI) was mostly interested about past experience/skills and passion for the research subject
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in *research subject*?

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: The asked for previous projects and course work, etc. Not really much else to say about this experience, was pretty straight forward . Not much else to say, just know the basics of programming.
Interview Questions: Previous projects?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back from them within a few days. Contacted me for an interview. It was an average interview. They asked me about my experience as an office assistant
Interview Questions: What is your experience with taking multiple phone calls

title: Research Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Apply through the university website with your cover letter and CV. The university will contact you if you are selected for the interview. The interview was conducted by a panel and they tested my knowledge, personality and skills.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: For my interview atleast there were too many situational judgement questions some of them were very difficult to answer. Overall the interview was very technical and formal. I found it quite difficult.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflicting deadlines?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Had a skype interview, were mostly interested in work experience and educational background. Time management, problem-solving skills are some important points to be addressed. Apart from research experience, your part-time job experience also adds value.
Interview Questions: Mostly what was your research about and how did you approach the problems

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for multiple roles and each one had similarities since they were all for SPA II roles.  In two interviews I had only two interviewers and the other there were four. An HR representative was not in a any of the interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you did not get along with a colleague.

title: Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: 3 on 1 interview with the Director, a business partner and the admin staff. it was very informal process and I was pre-screened to see if the salary expectations were reasonable for what I wanted.
Interview Questions: How would you handle requests from multiple departments and how would you organize yourself?

title: PMO Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
very comfortable and easy going, very nice people and good questions. I enjoyed the interview process and opportunity to thin before answering the questions.
It was a very good experience. I received some helpful tips as well
Interview Questions: Why you want to join our team

title: Documentation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions:
- easy and relaxed
- usual questions 
- made a great impression
- more information on the university as a whole would be nice, but overall great experience
- had a tour as well
Interview Questions:
- what draws you to the university
- relevant experience

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Good, friendly interview. The interviewers asked mostly behavioral questions and questions about the resume. The interview was great and they gave a lot of insight into the role. I applied online through the university website and got an email asking for an interview a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: questions on resume

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Behavioural interview with great managers, plenty of questions but made much easier by the positive vibe of those who are in interviewing. Nothing else to add, it had been a great experience.
Interview Questions: Usual behavioural interview questions

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a skype call as I was living in a different province at the time. I spoke with two supervisors and both were extremely nice and supportive of my application and motivations for the job.
Interview Questions: Would I be able to relocate to Calgary?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Job description: To Teach students, and help students with the assignment. And help the professors to correct and mark the exams.  They asked me how was my academic grade in this course and showed my ability to explain questions.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: Machine Learning Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with a professor, in their office. This was a Summer Student position, so they mostly asked the skills listed for the job such as machine learning, programming languages I use in class, etc.
Interview Questions: Do you know machine learning?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Call to know about background, previous experience and personal interests. Then, face to face interview about previous experience and aspirations. Technical capability assumed to be there. They wanted more information about motivation, future goals and my style of work
Interview Questions: What is your projection on climate change related issues?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: telephonic and detailed work related interview where we discussed the grant and work to be done here. The job was full time and lots of questions on skillset were asked.
Interview Questions: questions on previous work

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I actually applied to the job several months before I was called for an interview.  They had to get funding approved, so there was a bit of a delay.  I first met with my interviewer(s), for an initial screening, and it was a very pleasant experience.    It was more of a conversation than anything else.

After the screening interview, I received a phone interview from the Department head a week later.  I was formally offered employment approximately a week and a half later.

The overall process was relatively simple and straight forward.
Interview Questions: What skills and traits do you bring to a  technical Help Desk role?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Asked for different situations where you faced specific challenges, why specific things are important to the university community. They want to know that you are involved in the University community and not clueless. You are a ambassador, after all
Interview Questions: Who is the president of the University

title: IT Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very short and welcoming. The interview only lasted about 30 minutes and almost all of the questions were casual and reasonable. They mostly asked questions about social skills and little about  experience with technology. Was offered a second interview but they never followed through with a time and place.
Interview Questions: What do you find the most challenging when working in groups?

title: PASS Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty chill, makes you spend 5min teaching of whatever topics you're applying for (i.e, stat 213, acct 217, mgst 217). The questions they ask really aren't that hard, but obviously with anything, you should really try to prepare.
Interview Questions: How would manage being a PASS Leader while handling your academics

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: All done by email. I wrote asking for opportunity, we then exchange couple of emails and the Principal Investigator accepted me in his lab. The University asked for all documentations required to prove my PhD.
Interview Questions: There are five current lines of research in my lab, which one would you choose?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online via the job portal. I received a call about two/three weeks later for a pre-screening call, and then a call the following day with a proposal to come in for an interview for later that week. 
I was then emailed a copy of the job description and directions to the appropriate building on campus. 
I met with four people, three who worked in the office and one person from HR. I was asked a series of behavioural questions and asked to talk about my experience. 
They asked for three references and called them the following week. 
I received an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: How do you keep from getting bored with repetitive tasks?

title: Undergraduate Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I just applied and the interview is basically guaranteed. I also had to write a letter which is used for screening along with grades. Interview is in person and only 45 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Pretend I don't understand a concept. Show me how you'd teach it.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The job was posted on the career page. I applied.  A couple weeks later I got a call for an interview for the next day. I was told who would be on the interview panel which was made up of 3 people plus an HR staff member. I found out I did not get the position a couple of weeks later.
Interview Questions: Who is XX? (Tell us about you).

title: Marketing Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: There was about 2.5 months between making my application to when I was called in for an interview. The interview process was fairly quick once it got started - about 2 weeks between my initial screening and when I received an offer.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were fairly standard; tell us about relevant experience, how you handle challenges, etc.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: After a phone call about salary expectations and resume summary, an interview was arranged. The interview was almost an hour and included some technical questions, but mostly situational and interpersonal questions
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you dealt with this, did that, handled this that or the other.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Informal and 1:1. they were trying to make sure that you would be okay with mandatory teaching with children as they only have Saturday lessons for children which everyone has to take a shift on once a year for four months with 100% commitment to those shifts (not allowed to take Saturday lesson of or substitute.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a lifeguard and swim instructor here at the University of Calgary?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: An official interview at an office with one professor and two other assistants. Very relaxing and comfortable environment to chat in. The interview went on for about 15 - 20 minutes. Very straight forward questions, no behaviour questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 5/10 years?

title: Ski Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: One interview. Three interviewers, private space. The two managers of the department and the tech main supervisor. Interview allowed for personal explanation and was generally a question-answer format. There were no windows in the interview room.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience have you had with this kind of job in the past?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, common questions, the professor was very friendly, he talked about the very high standards of the research in his group and his high levels of demanding. The questions were easy and more related to the technical topics.
Interview Questions: Why do want to work with our group?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really engaging, very basic and to the point questions. Had a pleasant experience. The hiring manager was really nice. Notified about the result within couple of days.
Interview Questions: How would you manange your time with your current study commitments?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth but they lost my interview notes, intentionally staged me to fail, and hired someone who did not meet the minimum requirements for the position instead of an internal hire who had adequate experience.
Interview Questions: How do you react in situations when there's a policy you have to adhere to that frustrates you?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I already knew hiring manager and sent an email to him. I had skills that he was looking for. He hired me as a part time employee. After a few month, he changed it to full time.
Interview Questions: Did I have good knowledge in organic chemistry?

title: Alumni Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online
Had 2 interviews (first round with 2 leaders on immediate team, 2nd with sr leader for department) 
Fairly informal
Told me in second interview I was selected
Email 2 days after saying thank you for your time
Interview Questions:
Informal questions:
What did you do to prepare for interview, How you see this team bringing value to overall organization, Dealing with difficulty, Tops strengths/ weaknesses

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the University portal for jobs, Careerlink, at the Engineering Career Centre. They sent a mass email with more questions regarding availability, how I would contribute to the student experience, and my goals. I was selected for an interview with two interviewers where they asked behavioral questions for about 45 minutes. They called me for accepting the job offer later that day.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation where a co-worker/ friend/ family asked you confidential information that you weren't willing to share?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about 45 minutes. It started with some general questions, such as "tell us about yourself", then they asked about behavioral questions. It was just a question after another question, you didn't feel engaging. Finally the interview was wrapped up with salary expectation and inviting questions. In general it was a very standard interview.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the university?

title: Student Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Single interview. one on one interview. behaviour questions. pretty easy. They were not even professional.  Referral is definitely required. The job itself does not have much responsibility so they do not really care.
Interview Questions: How do u face conflict

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: applied for the job few weeks back, received a call from office administrator wanting to set up an interview. very surprised it was a panel interview! interviewers printed off interview questions from internet, made minimal eye contact when reading directly off the questions. anytime i answered a question, an interviewer would try to make eye contact with a fellow interviewer. very odd movement
Interview Questions: If you had to help the vice president, colleague, or patient; whom would you help first and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone and the one on one with the board. Tell us about your previous research, what where your challenges and how did you handle it. Have you ever had a project you didnt complete. what was the reason and how differently would you have done it next time
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you chose this Job

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with a prof and questions on research experience and current role. The overall process was relaxed. I heard back in 2 weeks time and an offer letter followed shortly after.
Interview Questions: What my career goal is short term and long term? How I would benefit the group?

title: Partnerships Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Questions related to previous experience and relevant courses as well as a small question in Spanish (for the Americas team), and a translating question as well. The interview process was fast, fair, and average in difficulty.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a coffee chat, and i knew the interviewer. She was kind and already had an brief idea of my work knowledge. It was really smooth and as expected i got the job. There were not many technical questions and interview was mostly based on my availability to work.
Interview Questions: Discussed my work experiance

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions:
Basic technical questions. 
Analysing the truss and asking about diffrent comouter program software and courses i had before. 
Some behavioural questions.
First interview was on skype with one of the super viaors which was close to 30 min length. The second one was in person with department head and the professor that i worked with. The overal interview was easy and you could find moat of the questions online.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with your supervisor?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I emailed a professor that I was interested in working with. I told him that I was interested in his research and asked if he was taking any students. We met informally in-person and emailed several times. I applied to the university and was provided with an offer 5 months later.
Interview Questions: What are your career plans?

title: Business Intelligence Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two individuals from two separate departments. Questions were general - usual behavioral questions. They had paper and taking notes on questions answered. Instant feedback after the interview. SOme personal questions such as are you married, I guess it was to know relocation possibilties.
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself, how you have managed team or a diffcult person

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: met with Principle Investigator to discuss their scope of research. Discussed what my role would be. Discussed my qualifications. Discussed the compensation package, hours of work and what my role in the laboratory would be
Interview Questions: What are your 5 year plans

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university website. There was no confirmation that my application was accepted. In a few days received a call to come for an interview in one week. It lasted 30 minutes, and was done by two people (direct managers, not HR). Decision was communicated through the email 5 days later.
Interview Questions: Describe previous work experience, detailed questions about the previous research topics, describe skills, career goals, why want the job, etc.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted to interview, First interview was with immediate management, went well, however they were reading almost exclusively off an interview questionnaire, so very little eye contact or organic conversation. Second interview was with potential Faculty staff to be supported in role, went much the same.
Interview Questions: Typical Interview questions, dealing with stress, competing priorities, etc...

title: Marketing Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions:
Telephone screening interview. Two in-person interviews.

Three panel interview. They seemed a bit too serious which may indicate the culture. 

I didn't hear from them for a few days after and followed up at the one-week mark to be informed they pursued someone else.
Interview Questions: How do you stay abreast of current marketing trends?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, they asked very common questions, greatest strengths, weaknesses, etc. they looked very busy, seems not prepared what to ask ...then I got email offer... it's a panel, while the HR didn't ask anything, most of the questions asked  by the manager. the supervisors asked tech questions
Interview Questions: why you want to work for us

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It started as a more exploratory phone call that led to an in person interview. Was hired at the end of the interview. The interviewer was very professional and answered all of my questions.
Interview Questions: Mostly asking for elaboration on CV.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty typical for a faculty position. Gave a couple of talks, did an interview with a search committee and with the associate Dean. In my case this interview predates the present University Culture which is stronger, more ambitious and more selective. In the future I believe the potential of a candidate to fit with University priorities will be a factor in Job hires.
Interview Questions:
Where I saw myself fitting in the department.
What sort of research program I would build.
Whether I saw potential for research with industry.

title: Institutional Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online, and about 2 months later I was called by HR for a phone screen. About a week later I received an assignment to complete over a few days. The next week, I had a Skype interview with a panel. It was a typical structured public sector interview, but a bit more laid-back.
Interview Questions: Please describe the steps you would take to write a research paper.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview last 40 mins. I was asked to talk about myself. Then the interviewer asked several behaviour questions. After a couple of days, I got the offer through an email.
Interview Questions: Why do you applied this position?

title: Senior Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was handled in a professional manner. Two people oversaw the interview. The questions were challenging enough that I needed to think about a few responses but not so overly challenging that I was stumped or stressed. They invited me to 'tell my story' which allowed me to focus on a few career highlights. They asked a few behavioural questions, such as "Tell us about a time when you and your supervisor disagreed about something. What was the issue and how did you resolve it?"
Interview Questions: What was a project you worked on that you are proud of, and why?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was 2 round interview with 2 people each time. The atmosphere was more official than in other companies. They were writing down all my answers and that made me think that they didn't listen to me as seemed to be busy with writing. It was also difficult to see their reaction. Anyways, I got to the second interview and it was a little victory :)
Interview Questions: A lot of behavior based questions including "what is the biggest challenge for the university in 2016?" Other questions: Why do you want to work here, Where do you want to be in 5 years, Give us an example of working independently, What are the challenges for you to be managed by several managers? Give us an example of your disagreement with your boss, How would you calculate the costs in case you need to implement a new program (I needed to say that I have to do a break even analysis first of all)? What motivates you?

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: this is a simple interview. they called for schedule a meeting with their manager team. after that, the second round interview met with your futhur supervisor and  boss.
Interview Questions: why you chose us?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: It took a long day. In the morning, I had a mock teaching session of 90 min. Met faculty members. Business lunch. After the lunch, there was a panel interview about teaching. There were at least 20 questions. Very formal. The people are nice and professional, asking all kinds of questions. Afterwards, made another presentation about research and met professors and students. Very busy schedule.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: A wonderful interview process with intelligent, serious people including both one-on-one interviews as well as several presentations and a panel interview. It is fairly typical of most academic interviews. Non-typical parts included a teaching presentation as well as a research presentation.
Interview Questions: What kind of research program will you set up?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: in person and informal.  had 2 separate interviews - with director and hiring manager. one on one.  asked to speak about specific experience and go over job history.  asked about style and approach.  discussed formal pm background.  discussed approach to risk, issues, scope and budget management.
Interview Questions: Describe your past experience managing projects

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had an over the phone interview with the PI. The position required the research assistant to spend a lot of time on the phone with participants, so his logic was to see how I handled a phone conversation with him. He mostly asked questions about my past work experience, what skills I had to offer, how I have handled work related situations in the past, and how I would handle hypothetical situations.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with statistical software?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
- got called in for interview
- she asked me about experience, some different situation questions and then showed me around the library
- she also tested me on how well i know the library shelving system
Interview Questions:
- why are you a good candidate for this position?
- how will your previous experience help you in this job?
- situation questions?

title: Alumni Programming Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first part is a phone interview with the Director of the department.  This is  followed by a three-person panel interview with about ten questions around the programming of the university, the strategic plan, and ways you can make their department better.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the university of Calgary?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview process. Basically, you find a professor that is willing to take you on as a graduate student and then complete a form. Upon acceptance into the department, you will receive a guaranteed stipend form to complete. Guaranteed stipends are usually around 19-21k depending on the Department.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to pursue a graduate degree?
What drew you to this research field?
Are you prepared for the workload of a PhD?

title: Events and Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Fairly straight-forward, typical process conducted by the boss and the person who was in the role at that time.
There wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Although you did have to do a decent amount of work on an assignment that was emailed in ahead of the interview.

Also, when it came time to discuss salary and I told them my range, but that it was negotiable depending on other benefits, that seemed to completely through the interviewer off... It's a line I've used many times in the past, which I believe conveys that if a company has 6 weeks of paid vacation, or phenomenal health spending accounts or bonuses then you're more than willing to take that into account during the salary discussion. But she seemed put off by it and asked what I meant by that and what kind of benefits I was referring to. Maybe because it's a union and everything is so set in stone that wasn't something she was used to thinking about but you can't expect that an interviewee is fully aware of the details of the contract without having seen it!
Interview Questions:
Time us about when you had to:
juggle conflicting priorities
deal with executives
prioritize and keep organized
etc...
How do you deal with stress, last minute changes, obstacles?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: I was selected for a face-to-face interview and then called in for a second interview. Its been quite some time since that interview. I still haven't heard back or got a rejection letter from them, though I sent follow up emails. Did anyone face this situation with UofC, because its very frustrating and unprofessional on the university's part.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult, I thought I aced it.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: I applied the job via email. My work was briefly described in the email. After a few weeks, I was contacted to schedule an interview through internet/conference call. I was asked mainly about my previous work experience and there were some behaviour questions as well. After a few days, they emailed to offer the position to me.
Interview Questions: Some technical questions related to future work

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Calgary in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: standard process, nothing special, 1 on 1, reviewed my grade for that lecture, the professor is great! nothing difficult, regular interview questions, personality questions. really great experience for practise job interview. highly recommended.
Interview Questions: standard questions

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Emailed, telling you were gonna be called to do a phone interview. Interview was extremely easy. Only lasted about 20 minutes tops, and most questions were straightforward, like what would you do if you were scheduled for a shift and had an essay due the next day? Overall it was easy, and I feel that they pretty much hire anyone that applies as it is an extremely hard job to do.
Interview Questions: How would you stay positive when calling people and getting yelled at?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, process took around 4 weeks after the position was closed. Got a call to schedule for an interview. There were 3 interviewers: HR Advisor, Department Officer, Department Team Lead - all took turns asking questions and took down notes.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your workload when all jobs are considered high priority?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had an informal "discussion" with a senior member of management to see if the role was a potential match and then had a formal interview with several members of the department.  The interview questions were a bit "canned" and there wasn't a lot of opportunity for me to ask questions.  A bit too structured for my likes.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult questions -- all pretty standard

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: As I was from another province, initially interviewed by two individuals-director and chair who would be my direct manager, first did a conference call then Skyped. It was amazing. The atmosphere was nice and friendly. Talked about the position and key elements they are wanting in an individual and what my experience would bring. Wanted to know about multi-tasking and if you have exp. using people-soft. Asked for three references and called references. True to their word. Said they were doing interviews for the whole week and you would find out by the end of the week or the beginning of the next week for their selection process. They called on Friday and I accepted the position. Amazing opportunity. I am so looking forward to working here!!
Interview Questions: Are you willing to relocate?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Very effecient at getting back to me and being flexible to arranging the next stage after my resume review.  Whole process made me feel at ease and confident.
Interview Questions: Projecting how I would manage a staff with whom I was not familiar with or their habits.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: No formal interview process. What I did was to propose a research topic to the professor who then asked me to further develop it for submission to the VP research for the Eyes High Postdoctoral Fellowship. I developed the proposal and we submitted it. After the review, we were informed that our submission is successful
Interview Questions: No particular questions. However, I did propose a research

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very relaxed, I had my interview with the professors I was going to be working with.  He asked question to get to know me better and tried to understand what my skills set it.
Interview Questions: If you have any experience with SPSS and how good you are at statistics

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I emailed him at first stating that I am interested to do my phd research under his supervision. Then he replied and we set up a meeting / interview time. My supervisor asked me about my previous research work experiences, tools I used before,  my research interests etc. And then described his research works, his expectations.
Interview Questions: Describe one of your previous research work.

title: Student Recruitment Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared to do an interview, it is one of the most important elements of selection. Lots of questions about the University and the student experience, be prepared to answer them.
Interview Questions: Some situational examples were required which can be difficult if you are applying as a new grad. Be sure to come prepared with some in your back pocket.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: get called after two weeks and then face to face interview
Interview Questions: very specific questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief skype interview after I sent the PI an email with my CV. Pretty easy process actually, but I think normally you have to go through their online system which can get tricky as an external candidate.
Interview Questions: Typical questions, interest and questions about skills and etc.

title: Course Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was extremely short. All that happened was that the Director of the department watched how I interacted with her two front office staff - one a long- time veteran of U of C and the other a second- language speaker (though not to the extent that it made the slightest difference). The director then asked standard resume-based follow-ups and we were done. The interview was, perhaps,15 minutes long.
Interview Questions: As I was applying for a course-developer position, I was asked to expand on my method of developing curricula in the past (previously, I worked as a front-line ESL teacher for 18 years). I was also asked to explain the present perfect verb tense; this seems to be a favourite question in the ESL hiring field.

title: Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Hired based on principle investigator (PI)'s decision. To get hired, email a professor with research in the field of your interest. Be prepared for rejection because summer studentships can be competitive. Some profs may choose not to take any students at all. There was no real interview process for myself but can depend on the professor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions: Personal interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Calgary
Interview Descriptions:
Informative, and inquiring interview.  Full overview of position provided, clear picture of the working environment and expectations, development abilities, working culture and services provided by the group.

Clear outline of the culture and how personality would be matched to the group.  outline of strategy, future projects and growth of the services and group.
Interview Questions: Describe when you had to approach a difficult conversation with diplomacy.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: sending CV and covering letter by email. If you are a good fit for the group you will be asking for 3 recommendation letters. after delivering the letters you will be interviewed by skype
Interview Questions: there were no difficult or unexpected questions

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Not hard. For my case they didn't even bother to ask a lot of questions. Pretty much Come and join us type attitude. Then I asked for the offer letter and they gave me one. I read the letter, liked it and eventually accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: What is your name ?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. got the phone interview. Over the phone, I was invited to a group interview and explained my experiences in 2 hours.  Next week I signed my contract.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for us?

title: Enrolment Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical behavioural interview process in front of a panel of 3 people. They asked a series of questions that they believed pertained to the job, and judged you on how on the quality of your answers and how you react to various scenarios. They then give you a chance to ask your own questions at the end. They notified me within a week.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you were confronted with a difficult inter-personal situation. What was it, how did you handle it?

title: Standardized Paitent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was casual, and long. It's basically just a long, very informal assessment of your personality and experience. Since it's an acting job and the manager there is an actor there is not a lot expected in terms of preparation or dress code. He is a really entertaining guy and besides a need to assess he seems to have a genuine interest in getting to know the people he will be working with. The work can be a little awkward and/or stressful at times and a good sense of humor with a professional attitude are important. Be prepared to be there for about 2 hours. Go to the bathroom ahead of time, don't have any imminent appointments.
Interview Questions: Nothing particularly difficult, lots that was unexpected since we just chatted without a particular topic after the first ten minutes. I suppose the most unexpected was "do you do any impressions?"

title: Medical Physicist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The typical interview consists of a teleconference (Skype-style) interaction with all the Medical Physics group or a selected hiring committee. The interview is aimed to filter out potential candidates that eventually will be invited for a site-visit interview. If invited for this, the candidate will be asked to give a talk on his/her topic of interest-research.
Interview Questions: What is your professional life plan for the next five years

title: PASS Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: most of the questions were from ur resume or CV. Some behavior type questions like " Do u ever have done some challenging somethings ? what was it ? how do u solve the problem?"  and ask u to image ur working day. One quesion is "This is a new program, how can u persuade others to attend?"
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Operations II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume online, and it was discarded by the hiring manager.  Luckily, I had a contact within the school who called her and asked for it to be reviewed.  Interviewed the hiring manager 1:1 and got the job.  It is difficult to get in the door at the University, so having an internal referral, and being willing to accept a temporary position until a permanent one comes available will increase the likelihood of you getting a job and staying there long-term.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Human Resources Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Internal job posting, was a presentation to show demonstrated skills in organizational design and strategic change. Behavioural questions from panel. Advice, come prepared with questions, and do your research on the particular department or area of interest. Use references from inside the organization to get a face-to-face interview. Very professional interview setting, takes a long time to get an offer though.
Interview Questions: How would you ensure the strategic plan of the institution was woven throughout this program (that I had to present)?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Individual faculty members tend to to unofficially interview candidates because of new hiring policies, they have to post the position publicly but want to make sure there's going to be at least one keeper. This will vary greatly between individual positions due to the individual people operating on their own. The HR process is excruciatingly slow. The technical questions seemed more design to filter out people that don't know what they're doing than to get to know the candidate.
Interview Questions: Which tool would you use to probe DNS servers?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Calgary in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: It is made directly with the supervisor and it depends on the person itself, I didn't have any interviews with the HR department. It is important to be clear with the supervisor that additional grants, awards, etc that you earn will be only for you, some supervisors, take that and put it into the lab or project "pot" and then you end up with just the base salary which is very low
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: For support staff and management, interviews are behaviour based, usually with 2-3 people on the interview panel.  There is usually a formal one hour first interview followed by a less formal second interview, and sometimes a third.  There is usually a short-list aiming for 5-6 initial interviews, and from there, the list is decreases to 2-3 candidates for a second interview.
Interview Questions: Most questions revolve around interpersonal skills and grace under pressure.  For example, the candidate is often asked to describe a conflict with their manager and describe how it was handled and resolved.

title: Team Leader, Administration Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Calgary (Calgary, AB) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: This was an interview for job reclassification and promotion.
Interview Questions: What challenges do you see as possible barriers to your success in this position.
